definition: east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish

sentences.english: The gatekeepers were on the four sides: east, west, north and south.
sentences.chinese: 在東西南北，四方都有守門的。

sentences.english: In four quarters were the porters， toward the east， west， north， and south.
sentences.chinese: 在東西南北，四方都有守門的。

sentences.english: Its shape is almost round. The highway runs through the island from all directions.
sentences.chinese: 島的形狀基本呈圓形，東西南北公路貫通。

definition: east, south, west and north/all directions
to turn upside down/to reverse/back to front/confused/deranged/crazy
to pay no attention to/to disregard/to ignore/to let go unpunished/to let off
wind and rain/the elements/trials and hardships
noble and lowly/high versus low social hierarchy of ruler to people, father to son, husband to wife in Confucianism
day and night/period of 24 hours/continuously, without stop
Kansai region, Japan/Guanxi or Kuanhsi town in Hsinchu County 新竹縣|新竹县[Xin1 zhu2 Xian4], northwest Taiwan

lit. warp and weft in weaving; vertically and horizontal/length and breadth/criss-crossed/able to move unhindered/abbr. for 合縱連橫|合纵连横[He2 zong4 Lian2 heng2], School of Diplomacy during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
